result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert R Kraayvanger

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Robert R Kraayvanger in court.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he received a letter from the State that he is no longer being charged and wonder why he is here today. Defendant provides copy of letter to the State. Defendant indicates he has a plan and is okay with not having an attorney to represent him. Defendant makes statements on the record. 
State indicates exactly what the letter is referencing. State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 909 Gorman St #6, Elkhorn, WI 53121

DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim LK Do not drive unless properly licensed. (person, property, residence or family).

2:32 PM Defendant Robert R Kraayvanger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Robert R Kraayvanger.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
